Package Actors

Class Player

java.lang.Object
java.awt.geom.RectangularShape
java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D
java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D.Double
Actors.MovingImage
Actors.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.Shape, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
public class Player
extends MovingImage
The Player class represents a real life player in the game
Author:
adityapanikkar

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player​(int x, int y, java.lang.String username, java.lang.String uniqueID, boolean hasBall, int playerType)
      Instantiates a new Player at (x, y) with username, a unique identifier, and a boolean that is true if the player possesses the ball or not
      Parameters:
      x - X coordinate of the player
      y - Y-coordinate of the player
      username - Name of each player
      uniqueID - The unique identifier of each player
      hasBall - True if player has ball and false if not

  • Method Details

      public int getShots()
      Returns:
      returns the number of shots taken by the player

      Parameters:

      public void spawnPowerup()
      Randomly spawns one of two possible powerups
      Postcondition:
      Spawns a new random power up and player's speed or jump height is increased

    • getPower

      public boolean getPower()
      Checks to see if the player currently has a powerup or does not
      Returns:
      True if the powerup is on or false if not

      Turns power up off when the timer ends
      Postcondition:
      The power up is turned off

      Postcondition:

    • walk

      public void walk​(double dir)
      This method represents the person taking a step and also includes the implementation of powerups
      Parameters:
      dir - the magnitude of the step distance
      Postcondition:
      X, Y, xvelocity, and yvelocity are updated according to actions executed

    • jump

      public void jump()
      This method represents the person jumping. it also accounts for the jump powerup
      Postcondition:
      Y velocity of the player is updated

      public void increaseScore​(int score)

      Precondition:
      The referee has been instantiated
      Postcondition:
      The score has increased and the referee blows whistle

      public void act​(java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Shape> obstacles, Player player2)
      This method represents the player acting and is called each time the game cycles
      Parameters:
      obstacles - A list containing shapes representing obstacles in the game
      player2 - Player in the game
      Postcondition:
      X, Y, and velocities are updated according to actions executed
